message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.HC, cs.MM, cs.SD 

This paper proposes a framework for human action recognition using body-worn inertial sensors, which involves signal processing, feature learning, and semantic analysis. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper involves human-computer interaction (cs.HC) and multimedia (cs.MM) aspects. Finally, the paper also involves statistical analysis and pattern recognition (cs.SD) to evaluate the proposed method.
